body_content.explanation: to make a person or thing become different or particular in some way:
examples: Her elaborate way of speaking individuates Maria from the other female characters.
Technology allows managers to individuate the production process into a series of unique tasks.

body_content.explanation: to become a person who thinks or behaves in their own original way:
examples: At the age of thirteen she began to individuate and become more of a rebel.
We spent a lot of time in our family group, but we were also allowed to individuate.
